news_header: U.S. mortgage applications declined by 1.3% for the week ending September 27, 2024, with a notable increase in purchase applications compared to last year.
news_text: According to the Mortgage Bankers Association's Weekly Applications Survey, U.S. mortgage applications fell by 1.3% for the week ending September 27, 2024. The Market Composite Index showed a 1% drop on an unadjusted basis, while the Refinance Index decreased by 3% but remained significantly higher than last year. The Purchase Index, however, increased by 1% and was up 9% compared to the same week in 2023. Mike Fratantoni, MBA's Chief Economist, noted solid economic growth despite rising mortgage rates, which slightly increased to 6.14%. Refinance applications accounted for 54.9% of total applications, down from the previous week. The average interest rates for various mortgage types, including conforming and FHA loans, saw slight increases.
